verses.verse: How hast thou helped<WH5826> him that is without power<WH3581>? how savest<WH3467> thou the arm<WH2220> that hath no<WH3808> strength<WH5797>?
How hast thou counselled<WH3289> him that hath no<WH3808> wisdom<WH2451>? and how hast thou plentifully<WH7230> declared<WH3045> the thing as it is<WH8454>?
To whom hast thou uttered<WH5046> words<WH4405>? and whose spirit<WH5397> came<WH3318> from thee?
Dead<WH7496> things are formed<WH2342> from under the waters<WH4325>, and the inhabitants<WH7931> thereof. and the: or, with the inhabitants
Hell<WH7585> is naked<WH6174> before him, and destruction<WH11> hath no covering<WH3682>.
He stretcheth out<WH5186> the north<WH6828> over the empty place<WH8414>, and hangeth<WH8518> the earth<WH776> upon nothing<WH1099>.
He bindeth up<WH6887> the waters<WH4325> in his thick clouds<WH5645>; and the cloud<WH6051> is not rent<WH1234> under them.
He holdeth back<WH270> the face<WH6440> of his throne<WH3678>, and spreadeth<WH6576> his cloud<WH6051> upon it.
He hath compassed<WH2328> the waters<WH6440> <WH4325> with bounds<WH2706>, until the day<WH216> and night<WH2822> come to an end<WH8503>. until: Heb. until the end of light with darkness
The pillars<WH5982> of heaven<WH8064> tremble<WH7322> and are astonished<WH8539> at his reproof<WH1606>.
He divideth<WH7280> the sea<WH3220> with his power<WH3581>, and by his understanding<WH8394> <WH8394> he smiteth<WH4272> through the proud<WH7293>. the proud: Heb. pride
By his spirit<WH7307> he hath garnished<WH8235> the heavens<WH8064>; his hand<WH3027> hath formed<WH2342> the crooked<WH1281> serpent<WH5175>.
Lo, these are parts<WH7098> of his ways<WH1870>: but how little<WH8102> a portion<WH1697> is heard<WH8085> of him? but the thunder<WH7482> of his power<WH1369> who can understand<WH995>?
